channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US in uncharted territory as states keep smashing Covid-19 records and cities threaten stay-at-home orders
Trump says he'll resume giving coronavirus briefings
'He's unteachable': Doctor blasts Trump's latest mask remarks
item.description: Dr. Jonathan Reiner reacts to President Donald Trump's comments about a national mask mandate during an interview with Fox News' Chris Wallace.

item.title: The 55 most shocking lines from Chris Wallace's interview with Donald Trump
item.description: President Donald Trump sat for an interview that aired over the weekend with "Fox News Sunday" host Chris Wallace, one of the most skilled -- and best -- interviewers in the news business. It did not go well for the President.

item.title: City that had no Covid-19 cases now declared 'wartime' state
Fox News host grills President Trump about cognitive test
item.description: "Fox News Sunday" host Chris Wallace interviews President Donald Trump, fact-checking him in real time about various assertions including that Joe Biden wants to "abolish" the police.

item.title: UK suspends Hong Kong extradition treaty, citing 'serious concerns' with Beijing's security law
item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says the UK will change its extradition arrangements with Hong Kong to reflect his government's "serious concerns" about its new security law, but called for engagement with China.

item.title: Denmark's controversial 'social experiment'
item.description: Muhammad Aslam loves his home -- an apartment in a low-rise public housing estate at the heart of the diverse and gentrifying Copenhagen neighborhood of Norrebro.

item.title: It took only days for a fire to hinder the US Navy's Pacific fleet for years to come
item.description: A massive blaze aboard a billion-dollar US Navy warship has been extinguished after raging for four days -- but its effect might be felt across America's Pacific Fleet for years.

item.title: Gunman dressed as FedEx driver who shot federal judge's son and husband at their home dies from self-inflicted gunshot
item.description: A gunman opened fire at the home of US District Court of New Jersey Esther Salas on Sunday in North Brunswick, killing her son and injuring her husband, according to the federal courthouse's top judge.

item.title: CNN Poll of Polls: Biden maintains double-digit lead over Trump
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden leads President Donald Trump by a significant 12-point margin nationally, according to a CNN Poll of Polls released Monday.

item.title: Whistleblower raised concerns about 'questionable activities' by Pompeo
item.description: A State Department official raised concerns to the agency's watchdog about "questionable activities" related to Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's conduct, according to a whistleblower complaint made public in recent days.

item.title: Sweden pays human and economic toll for not locking down
item.description: Sweden's soft approach to the coronavirus pandemic has been controversial as the country opted against locking down to protect the economy. However, Sweden hasn't been spared from great economic pain. CNN's Phil Black reports.

item.title: Tower of London's famous Beefeaters facing job losses for first time in 500-year history
item.description: Beefeaters, the Yeoman Warders who live and work at the Tower of London, are facing job losses for the first time in their 500-year history.

item.title: The UAE has successfully launched the Arab world's first Mars mission
item.description: The United Arab Emirates successfully launched its Mars-bound Hope Probe on Sunday, marking the the Arab world's first interplanetary mission -- and the first of three international missions to the Red Planet this summer.

item.title: CNN obtains footage showing inside a Russian research lab
item.description: Footage from inside a tightly controlled research lab in Moscow offers CNN an exclusive glimpse inside Russia's rapid push for a coronavirus vaccine. CNN's Matthew Chance reports the race for a vaccine raises concerns the nation may be cutting legal and ethical corners.

item.title: EU's future at stake as tempers fray at summit on recovery fund
Trump's 'law and order' is starting to look like martial law
item.description: The strange and frightening images of unidentified military-looking men taking protesters off the streets of Portland, Oregon, and into unmarked vans may be headed to a city near you if that city is, as President Donald Trump declared Monday, run by "liberal Democrats."

item.title: Can the US election be postponed or changed?
What Fauci's boss would do if asked by Trump to fire him
item.description: Director of the National Institutes of Health Dr. Francis Collins, who is Dr. Anthony Fauci's boss, is asked about what he would do if he were asked by President Trump to fire Fauci.

item.title: This could have predicted deadly volcano
item.description: Scientists in New Zealand have invented an alert system to provide warnings ahead of volcanic eruptions -- a system which, they say, could have predicted 2019's deadly White Island blast.

item.title: Video shows animals trying to escape from flooding amid destruction in Asia
item.description: Widespread flooding caused by continuous heavy monsoon rains have been ravaging Asia: Home and farms are under water in Bangladesh and India; Banks of China's main river are under strain. CNN's Paula Hancocks reports.

item.title: Kanye West's threat tanks Gap's stock price
item.description: Kanye West's threat to walk away from his fashion company's fledgling partnership with the Gap has sent shares sharply lower.

item.title: Police find shipment of coffee beans stuffed with cocaine
item.description: Police in Italy discovered cocaine stuffed inside individually hollowed-out coffee beans, after opening a parcel addressed to a fictional Mafia boss from a Hollywood movie.

item.title: Amber Heard says Johnny Depp 'threatened to kill me many times'
item.description: US actress Amber Heard has alleged in court that her ex-husband Johnny Depp threatened to kill her "many times," especially later in their relationship, UK's PA Media reported on Monday.

item.title: Fareed: Joe Biden's economic plan is much better than Trump's approach
item.description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria breaks down the economic aspects of 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden's "Build Back Better" plan in comparison to President Donald Trump's practices.

item.title: 1,800 tons of illegal toxic waste dumped at Malaysian port
item.description: Malaysia has discovered 110 containers of illegally dumped toxic waste in what authorities are calling "the biggest finding of its kind" in the country's history, according to state media Bernama.

item.title: Protests in Portland have carried on for more than 50 days. Here's how they started
item.description: For more than fifty days, protests in Portland have carried on. While many have been peaceful, those demonstrations have also been marked by violence, vandalism, arson, arrests and allegations of police brutality.

item.title: Drone footage shows former copper mine turning river orange
item.description: Water from a former copper mine runs into a river in the Russian Ural mountains.

item.title: Most polar bears could struggle to survive in the Arctic by 2100, study finds
item.description: For many people, there is one animal that comes to mind when they think of creatures threatened by climate change: the polar bear.

item.title: How John Lewis befriended a young boy and changed his life forever
item.description: When she saw the news Friday night that John Lewis had died, Lauren Annarino of Johnson City, Tennessee, picked up the phone to make a dreaded call to her 12-year-old grandson.

item.title: The Amazon is being destroyed at record rates
item.description: As Brazil struggles to contain the coronavirus, the Amazon is also being destroyed at record rates under President Jair Bolsonaro's watch. CNN's Bill Weir reports.

item.title: Amsterdam's 'prostitute hotel' plan to uproot red light district
item.description: When the Netherlands introduced lockdown measures in mid-March, Amsterdam's Red Light District transformed into a ghost town overnight. Coronavirus dealt a devastating blow to the Dutch capital's notorious window brothels and left over 300 legally operating sex workers without an income for almost four months.

item.title: A comet will streak across the sky for the rest of the month. Here's how to watch.
item.description: Stargazers in the Northern Hemisphere should enjoy every opportunity to see the new Comet NEOWISE as it streaks across the evening sky for the rest of July.

item.title: Keanu Reeves is writing comic books -- the first issue is out in October
item.description: Actor, musician, film producer and, now, comic-book writer. Is there anything Keanu Reeves can't do?

item.title: Nicki Minaj announces pregnancy
item.description: First came love, then came marriage and soon will come Nicki Minaj with a baby carriage.

item.title: See pup's heart-stopping close call on busy interstate
item.description: While attending to a multi-vehicle crash on I-495, emergency personnel scrambled to chase down a dog named Astro that belonged to one of the people involved in the accident. CNN affiliate WJLA reports.

item.title: Lionel Messi claims record-breaking seventh golden boot
item.description: Lionel Messi continues to ruthlessly tear through the record books.

item.title: LeBron James trading card sold for $1.8 million at auction
item.description: A rare LeBron James trading card sold for a record-breaking $1.845 million at auction over the weekend, the NBA said.

item.title: She works as a dishwasher to see her husband amid Covid-19
item.description: Mary Daniel took a job as a dishwasher at her husband's senior care facility when coronavirus safety precautions put an end to visitations, and she tells CNN's Fredricka Whitfield the idea struck her at the beginning of the pandemic.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton criticizes Formula One for 'lacking leadership' in the fight against racism
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says Formula One must do more in the fight against racism as he criticized some of his rival drivers for not taking the issue seriously enough.

item.title: Dominique Fung upends the objectification of Asian women in surreal paintings
item.description: In Dominique Fung's paintings, baby blue hues dance with pastel pinks to create, at first glance, playful fantasies with Asian motifs. Like the works of Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres and Jean-Léon Gérôme, Fung's scenes entice with nude women reclining among porcelain vessels. However, closer inspection reveals stray knives, impaled fruit and dismembered limbs; the mirage dematerializes.

item.title: 20 of the world's best places for swimming
item.description: From isolated English beaches to plunge pools in the Costa Rican cloud forest. Icy ponds at five-star hotels in the heart of Peru to quiet riverbanks in the Japanese Alps.

item.title: A preliminary Covid-19 vaccine trial involving 1,077 people in five UK hospitals suggests that it is safe
Trump says US has 'best mortality rate' in the world. That's not true
item.description: During a meandering and occasionally hostile interview with Fox News on Sunday, President Donald Trump made a very bold claim: that the United States has the lowest mortality rate from Covid-19 anywhere in the world.

item.title: The single most damning quote about Trump and coronavirus yet
item.description: In The New York Times' Sunday opus on how cracks are emerging between President Donald Trump and the broader Republican Party in how to handle the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, a single quote stands out.

item.title: Trump to resume regular coronavirus briefings as cases surge
item.description: President Donald Trump said Monday he'll resume regular coronavirus briefings as the country experiences a resurgence of cases.

item.title: The race against time to find Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Scientists from around the world are racing to develop a vaccine to tackle the spread of the novel coronavirus.

item.title: Why a country with no Covid-19 cases is joining the vaccine race
item.description: North Korea says it is joining the race to develop a Covid-19 vaccine, a global contest that has already drafted in some of the world's best medical minds and is shaping up to cost billions of dollars.

item.title: China's ambassador to US says America must make 'fundamental choice'
item.description: • Exclusive interview: CNN's Fareed Zakaria sits down with Ambassador Cui Tiankai
